H0.text: Which mammal constructs a lodge in which to store food, rear young, and pass the winter. Otter

H1.text: Which mammal constructs a lodge in which to store food, rear young, and pass the winter. Muskrat

H2.text: Which mammal constructs a lodge in which to store food, rear young, and pass the winter. Marmot

H3.text: Which mammal constructs a lodge in which to store food, rear young, and pass the winter. Beever

A4.text: Beavers need trees and shrubs to use as building material for dams, which restrict flowing water to create a pond for them to live in, and for lodges, which act as shelters and refuges from predators and the elements.

A5.text: After they are born, the kits spend their first one to two months in the lodge.
